column2: I was warned that if I did not renounce the greed that had begun to consume me, I would run into the same kind of trouble as the wife in the fable Shita-kiri Suzume.
column3: I was warned that if I did not renounce the greed that had begun to consume me, I would run into the same kind of trouble as the wife in the fable Shita-kiri Suzume.

column2: Monsters and ogres do not exist!
column3: Monsters and ogres do not exist!

column2: The more I care for the happiness of others, the greater my own sense of well-being.
column3: The more I care for the happiness of others, the greater my own sense of well-being.

column2: The need to be better than everyone else is strong inside me today. I both long and fear for envy to show me the way to distinguish myself from the rest.
column3: The need to be better than everyone else is strong inside me today. I both long and fear for envy to show me the way to distinguish myself from the rest.

column2: While meditating, I try to extend my love and kindness to myself, then my family, my friends, and my teachers. I fail to understand why I should love strangers and my enemies, though I try to include them as well.
column3: While meditating, I try to extend my love and kindness to myself, then my family, my friends, and my teachers. I fail to understand why I should love strangers and my enemies, though I try to include them as well.

column2: I do not care what my Zen teacher says: if someone makes me angry, I will act on it. Even when he insists that "No one makes you angry. You make yourself angry", I cannot agree.
column3: I do not care what my Zen teacher says: if someone makes me angry, I will act on it. Even when he insists that "No one makes you angry. You make yourself angry", I cannot agree.

column2: Although showered with rude, harsh words, I held my tongue and did not respond in kind. My patience is my strength, the only fort no one can break down.
column3: Although showered with rude, harsh words, I held my tongue and did not respond in kind. My patience is my strength, the only fort no one can break down.

column2: I am sitting on a mountain top - it is hard and nothing grows here. But I got myself all this way, so I won't step down or admit that, because of my pride, my behind is frozen to the ground.
column3: I am sitting on a mountain top - it is hard and nothing grows here. But I got myself all this way, so I won't step down or admit that, because of my pride, my behind is frozen to the ground.

column2: I remember only one half of a certain saying, but I feel it really applies to me: "A person is like a fertile field, if he puts himself in a lower position".
column3: I remember only one half of a certain saying, but I feel it really applies to me: "A person is like a fertile field, if he puts himself in a lower position".

column2: Being confronted with my misdeed, I could only reply "I did not".
column3: Being confronted with my misdeed, I could only reply "I did not".

column2: To be honest can be hard work, but I know it will benefit me in the end.
column3: To be honest can be hard work, but I know it will benefit me in the end.

column2: When my enemy roared "Katsu!" - "Victory!" - I could not explain the feeling that seemed to seep through my bones, eating away at my strength. Instead of standing tall, I turned and fled.
column3: When my enemy roared "Katsu!" - "Victory!" - I could not explain the feeling that seemed to seep through my bones, eating away at my strength. Instead of standing tall, I turned and fled.

column2: Even a brave person needs courage to do what is right, if it is something the person fears. I feel I am as courageous and brave as necessary.
column3: Even a brave person needs courage to do what is right, if it is something the person fears. I feel I am as courageous and brave as necessary.

column2: A brave man acknowledges his fears.
column3: A brave man acknowledges his fears.

column2: I am going to be the greatest $CHARACTERTITLE$ ever!
column3: I am going to be the greatest $CHARACTERTITLE$ ever!

column2: I have come as far as I want to. I feel no need to keep pushing myself.
column3: I have come as far as I want to. I feel no need to keep pushing myself.

column2: Someone once told me, "Be as just as you can, and if you cannot be just, be arbitrary".
column3: Someone once told me, "Be as just as you can, and if you cannot be just, be arbitrary".

column2: I treat my inferiors as I would want my superiors to treat me, and word of my justice has reached even the mightiest of daimyos.
column3: I treat my inferiors as I would want my superiors to treat me, and word of my justice has reached even the mightiest of daimyos.

column2: No matter what Confucius or Buddha says, mankind is unlovable.
column3: No matter what Confucius or Buddha says, mankind is unlovable.

column2: I have finally understood what the fable Shita-kiri Suzume tries to explain.
column3: I have finally understood what the fable Shita-kiri Suzume tries to explain.

column2: I cannot feel love anymore, not even for friends.
column3: I cannot feel love anymore, not even for friends.

column3: To always be honest is a tiresome act. To lie is easier.

column3: While looking for something to do, my eyes fell upon a strange book in a secluded corner of my library. The title had almost completely faded away, but I could make out "The way of..."

column3: I won too many times against my friend and he left, taking his goban, goke, and goishi with him. I have already ordered a set of my own, with a floor board made of kaya, bowls of rosewood, and the white stones made of clamshell, the black ones of slate.

column3: A new gardener was hired and set to work, while I tried to find a haven from my ruined garden. A shaded glade where the relaxing sounds of a small stream and rustling leaves joined together in a soothing tune provided me the peace I needed.

column2: I fired the gardener (though I felt tempted to remove his head) and started planning my new garden. The stepping stones for traversing the small creek would not do - a bridge should replace them, and a pavilion should be built nearby...
column3: I fired the gardener (though I felt tempted to remove his head) and started planning my new garden. The stepping stones for traversing the small creek would not do - a bridge should replace them, and a pavilion should be built nearby...

column2: ...and this lantern should be over there...
column3: ...and this lantern should be over there...

column2: My new garden with its bridge, lanterns of stone and wide variety of plants could be sufficient for my needs. I should be able to relax and paint now, instead of worrying about it...but don't know if I dare.
column3: My new garden with its bridge, lanterns of stone and wide variety of plants could be sufficient for my needs. I should be able to relax and paint now, instead of worrying about it...but don't know if I dare.

column2: I have a couple more ideas...
column3: I have a couple more ideas...

column2: My new haven has made me forget about the ruined garden, and my technique has never been better. I have almost mastered the suibokuga style. The austere monochrome style of ink painting puts me to the test, but I think I have nailed it.
column3: My new haven has made me forget about the ruined garden, and my technique has never been better. I have almost mastered the suibokuga style. The austere monochrome style of ink painting puts me to the test, but I think I have nailed it.

column2: My brush and ink lie forgotten in my chamber, and the only color on my hands these days are the murky brown of earth and the green from the juice of the grass.
column3: My brush and ink lie forgotten in my chamber, and the only color on my hands these days are the murky brown of earth and the green from the juice of the grass.

column2: My eager courtship has gotten me nowhere, and my lady's icy response can cool even the warmest of hearts. I will not give up! There must be something I can do to win her affection.
column3: My eager courtship has gotten me nowhere, and my lady's icy response can cool even the warmest of hearts. I will not give up! There must be something I can do to win her affection.

column2: I shall write her love songs!
column3: I shall write her love songs!

column2: I should try to forget her.
column3: I should try to forget her.

column2: My attempts to make her mine have been to no avail.
column3: My attempts to make her mine have been to no avail.

column2: I should hire some biwa hoshi instead.
column3: I should hire some biwa hoshi instead.

column2: I struggled with the poem for several days, and with a trembling heart, I sent it to her. Her response was warm and lovely, and it seems that the ice princess has finally thawed.
column3: I struggled with the poem for several days, and with a trembling heart, I sent it to her. Her response was warm and lovely, and it seems that the ice princess has finally thawed.

column2: I practiced and practiced for several days before I mustered the courage to present her with the song I had written for her.
column3: I practiced and practiced for several days before I mustered the courage to present her with the song I had written for her.

column2: Her heart has thawed for me!
column3: Her heart has thawed for me!

column2: I spent so much time tuning my shamisen that I feared the strings would snap when I was to finally play. Fortunately, the strings held and the music was much appreciated, not only by the lady of my heart but also by her father.
column3: I spent so much time tuning my shamisen that I feared the strings would snap when I was to finally play. Fortunately, the strings held and the music was much appreciated, not only by the lady of my heart but also by her father.

column2: For every poem I write for her, a bigger piece of her heart belongs to me. I have selected a couple of her favourites and given them to the monks to be illustrated and properly transcribed.
column3: For every poem I write for her, a bigger piece of her heart belongs to me. I have selected a couple of her favourites and given them to the monks to be illustrated and properly transcribed.

column2: I hope she will like it.
column3: I hope she will like it.

column2: All my poems in a book.
column3: All my poems in a book.

column2: The music flows through my body, and my hands pluck tones from the shamisen as I have never heard. My voice sings in harmony with the instrument, and I feel alive.
column3: The music flows through my body, and my hands pluck tones from the shamisen as I have never heard. My voice sings in harmony with the instrument, and I feel alive.

column2: I was mortified and then furious as the monk told me that they liked my poetry so much that they produced several copies for sale. The lady of my heart did not seem to care, though, as she just kissed me sweetly and told me she already had a copy.
column3: I was mortified and then furious as the monk told me that they liked my poetry so much that they produced several copies for sale. The lady of my heart did not seem to care, though, as she just kissed me sweetly and told me she already had a copy.

column3: I will never write another poem!

column3: Some hunting will cheer me up.

column3: Perhaps I should send for a new bird...

column3: The hunt was a huge disappointment - there was no game in sight, and my horse threw me off.

column3: The new goshawk had not been properly trained. It attacked one of the dogs and had to be killed before it released its grip on the poor, wailing hound.

column3: I lost game after game and soon grew restless while my friend endlessly asked for just one more.

column3: A letter arrived from the local Buddhist monks in [Root.GetName] today, asking for my permission to start construction on a Buddhist temple in the province. They offered to take the entire cost upon themselves, but in return, they asked for a more modest tax policy during construction.

column2: I was visited today by a Buddhist monk from [Root.GetName], and he told me that the local temple has finally been completed.
column3: I was visited today by a Buddhist monk from [Root.GetName], and he told me that the local temple has finally been completed.

column2: A large procession of Buddhist monks has marched into my capital, demanding that the Shinto shrines and Christian churches in [Root.GetName] be torn down. Otherwise, they threaten to take matters into their own hands.
column3: A large procession of Buddhist monks has marched into my capital, demanding that the Shinto shrines and Christian churches in [Root.GetName] be torn down. Otherwise, they threaten to take matters into their own hands.

column3: I would never destroy religious buildings.

column2: I will order that the churches be razed to the ground.

They offered to take the entire cost upon themselves, but in return, they asked for a more modest tax policy during construction.

column3: I will order that the shrines be razed to the ground.

column2: I will order that the temples be razed to the ground.

column2: My invincible forces have taken control of the province of [Root.GetName] and have driven out the rebels.
column3: My invincible forces have taken control of the province of [Root.GetName] and have driven out the rebels.

column2: My lord, a ninja has managed to avoid our guards and sneak into the castle. He hid under a staircase, and when [Prev.GetFullName] ascended the stairs, he thrust a spear between the steps and killed him. The guards caught him just as he was about to escape through a window. He was sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, a ninja has managed to avoid our guards and sneak into the castle. He hid under a staircase, and when [Prev.GetFullName] ascended the stairs, he thrust a spear between the steps and killed him. The guards caught him just as he was about to escape through a window. He was sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, we have caught a ninja hiding in the castle. We believe he came to assassinate [Prev.GetFullName]. He was sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, we have caught a ninja hiding in the castle. We believe he came to assassinate [Prev.GetFullName]. He was sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, a group of ninjas has managed to scale the castle walls and kidnap [Prev.GetFullName]. The guards were able to catch one, and it turns out that they were sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, a group of ninjas has managed to scale the castle walls and kidnap [Prev.GetFullName]. The guards were able to catch one, and it turns out that they were sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, we have just uncovered a plot to kidnap [Prev.GetFullName]. A ninja was able to sneak into the castle by disguising himself as a Buddhist monk. It turns out that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, we have just uncovered a plot to kidnap [Prev.GetFullName]. A ninja was able to sneak into the castle by disguising himself as a Buddhist monk. It turns out that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, a group of ninjas managed to infiltrate your castle by scaling the walls. They freed our hostage, [Prev.GetFullName], who got away with a few of them before the rest were caught by the guards. We have learned that they were sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, a group of ninjas managed to infiltrate your castle by scaling the walls. They freed our hostage, [Prev.GetFullName], who got away with a few of them before the rest were caught by the guards. We have learned that they were sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, the guards have caught a ninja trying to spring one of our hostages, [Prev.GetFullName]. He was mortally wounded while trying to escape, but before he died, we got him to give up his employer: [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, the guards have caught a ninja trying to spring one of our hostages, [Prev.GetFullName]. He was mortally wounded while trying to escape, but before he died, we got him to give up his employer: [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, it turns out a ninja managed to sneak into the castle and steal your personal seal. He used it to falsify a letter in which you were conspiring to assassinate the Emperor! We tracked him down and forced him to reveal his employer: [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, it turns out a ninja managed to sneak into the castle and steal your personal seal. He used it to falsify a letter in which you were conspiring to assassinate the Emperor! We tracked him down and forced him to reveal his employer: [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, the guards have caught a ninja sneaking around the castle. He was planting fake documents that indicated you were planning to assassinate the Emperor! He has confessed that he was sent by [From.GetFullName] to try and undermine your honor.
column3: My lord, the guards have caught a ninja sneaking around the castle. He was planting fake documents that indicated you were planning to assassinate the Emperor! He has confessed that he was sent by [From.GetFullName] to try and undermine your honor.

column2: My lord, a group of ninjas was caught in [Prev.GetName], but not before they managed to burn down a large portion of the castle. Apparently, they managed to steal and replicate a lantern bearing your family crest. By carrying a number of the replicas, they were allowed to enter the castle without a fight. It will take six months to repair the damage. They were sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, a group of ninjas was caught in [Prev.GetName], but not before they managed to burn down a large portion of the castle. Apparently, they managed to steal and replicate a lantern bearing your family crest. By carrying a number of the replicas, they were allowed to enter the castle without a fight. It will take six months to repair the damage. They were sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, a group of ninjas sent by the treacherous [From.GetFullName] were captured trying to burn down the castle in [Prev.GetName].
column3: My lord, a group of ninjas sent by the treacherous [From.GetFullName] were captured trying to burn down the castle in [Prev.GetName].

column2: My lord, a ninja disguised as a priest entered the Shinto shrine in [Prev.GetName] and cut down two of the priests before being captured. The Shintoists seem to suspect that you are behind the attack, even though I have forced the ninja to confess that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, a ninja disguised as a priest entered the Shinto shrine in [Prev.GetName] and cut down two of the priests before being captured. The Shintoists seem to suspect that you are behind the attack, even though I have forced the ninja to confess that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, we have uncovered a plot by the villainous [From.GetFullName]. He sent a ninja to assassinate the local Shinto priests in [Prev.GetName], and then to blame the crime on you in order to ruin your relation with their faction.
column3: My lord, we have uncovered a plot by the villainous [From.GetFullName]. He sent a ninja to assassinate the local Shinto priests in [Prev.GetName], and then to blame the crime on you in order to ruin your relation with their faction.

column2: My lord, a ninja disguised as a monk entered the Buddhist temple in [Prev.GetName] and cut down two of the monks before being captured. The Buddhists seem to suspect that you are behind the attack, even though I have forced the ninja to confess that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, a ninja disguised as a monk entered the Buddhist temple in [Prev.GetName] and cut down two of the monks before being captured. The Buddhists seem to suspect that you are behind the attack, even though I have forced the ninja to confess that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, we have uncovered a plot by the villainous [From.GetFullName]. He sent a ninja to assassinate the local Buddhist monks in [Prev.GetName], and then to blame the crime on you in order to ruin your relation with their faction.
column3: My lord, we have uncovered a plot by the villainous [From.GetFullName]. He sent a ninja to assassinate the local Buddhist monks in [Prev.GetName], and then to blame the crime on you in order to ruin your relation with their faction.

column2: My lord, a ninja disguised as a priest entered the Christian church in [Prev.GetName] and cut down two of the priests before being captured. The Christians seem to suspect that you are behind the attack, even though I have forced the ninja to confess that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].
column3: My lord, a ninja disguised as a priest entered the Christian church in [Prev.GetName] and cut down two of the priests before being captured. The Christians seem to suspect that you are behind the attack, even though I have forced the ninja to confess that he was sent by [From.GetFullName].

column2: My lord, we have uncovered a plot by the villainous [From.GetFullName]. He sent a ninja to assassinate the local Christian priests in [Prev.GetName], and then blame the crime on you in order to ruin your relation with their faction.
column3: My lord, we have uncovered a plot by the villainous [From.GetFullName]. He sent a ninja to assassinate the local Christian priests in [Prev.GetName], and then blame the crime on you in order to ruin your relation with their faction.

column2: My lord, a group of ninjas was killed in a fierce fight with the village guards in [Prev.GetName]. They burned down one of the guilds, and it seems that [From.GetFullName] was behind the attack.
column3: My lord, a group of ninjas was killed in a fierce fight with the village guards in [Prev.GetName]. They burned down one of the guilds, and it seems that [From.GetFullName] was behind the attack.

column2: My lord, a ninja sent by [From.GetFullName] was caught by the village guards in [Prev.GetName] as he was trying to set fire to one of the guilds there.
column3: My lord, a ninja sent by [From.GetFullName] was caught by the village guards in [Prev.GetName] as he was trying to set fire to one of the guilds there.

column2: Expose him and his shameful deed.
column3: Expose him and his shameful deed.

column2: What is done is done. Let it be.
column3: What is done is done. Let it be.

column2: My lord, the ninjas we sent against [From.Prev.GetFullName] succeeded in their mission but were caught shortly afterwards. [From.Prev.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.
column3: My lord, the ninjas we sent against [From.Prev.GetFullName] succeeded in their mission but were caught shortly afterwards. [From.Prev.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.

column2: My lord, the ninjas we sent against [From.Prev.GetFullName] failed in their mission and were caught. [From.Prev.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.
column3: My lord, the ninjas we sent against [From.Prev.GetFullName] failed in their mission and were caught. [From.Prev.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.

column2: My lord, the ninjas we sent to [From.Prev.GetName] succeeded in their mission but were caught shortly after. [From.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.
column3: My lord, the ninjas we sent to [From.Prev.GetName] succeeded in their mission but were caught shortly after. [From.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.

column2: My lord, the ninjas we sent to [From.Prev.GetName] failed in their mission and were caught. [From.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.
column3: My lord, the ninjas we sent to [From.Prev.GetName] failed in their mission and were caught. [From.GetFullName] has spread the news about this in an attempt to diminish your honor, and I am afraid he has succeeded.

column2: At least the mission was completed.
column3: At least the mission was completed.

column2: A most unfortunate turn of events.
column3: A most unfortunate turn of events.

column2: A messenger arrived from [Root.GetName] today. During the last day's storm, a Chinese ship was blown ashore near a small fishing village along the coast. The ship belongs to Chinese traders, but with them were three foreigners they call "Portuguese".\n\nIt will take some time before their ship can be repaired. In the meantime, should I perhaps pay them a visit?
column3: A messenger arrived from [Root.GetName] today. During the last day's storm, a Chinese ship was blown ashore near a small fishing village along the coast. The ship belongs to Chinese traders, but with them were three foreigners they call "Portuguese".\n\nIt will take some time before their ship can be repaired. In the meantime, should I perhaps pay them a visit?

column2: That could be an interesting experience.
column3: That could be an interesting experience.

column2: I will pay these Portuguese a visit.
column3: I will pay these Portuguese a visit.

column2: No, I have no interest in foreign matters.
column3: No, I have no interest in foreign matters.

column2: I met the stranded Portuguese traders today. Despite speaking different languages, the meeting turned out very well. I gave them a tour of the local castle and invited them to join me in a tea ceremony.\n\nThey seemed very grateful, and as a token of their appreciation, they gave me a strange gift: a lightweight firearm they called an "arquebus". In a demonstration, they fired a small lead ball straight through a wooden wall!
column3: I met the stranded Portuguese traders today. Despite speaking different languages, the meeting turned out very well. I gave them a tour of the local castle and invited them to join me in a tea ceremony.\n\nThey seemed very grateful, and as a token of their appreciation, they gave me a strange gift: a lightweight firearm they called an "arquebus". In a demonstration, they fired a small lead ball straight through a wooden wall!

column2: I must have my swordsmith try and make more!
column3: I must have my swordsmith try and make more!

column2: Madness! These must be locked away.
column3: Madness! These must be locked away.

column2: My swordsmith in [Root.GetName] informed me today that he has so far been unable to reproduce the Portuguese arquebus. He still believes that he can, though, and asked for more time and money.
column3: My swordsmith in [Root.GetName] informed me today that he has so far been unable to reproduce the Portuguese arquebus. He still believes that he can, though, and asked for more time and money.

column2: I know some good will come of it.
column3: I know some good will come of it.

column2: No, this is a waste of resources.
column3: No, this is a waste of resources.

column2: My swordsmith in [Root.GetName] visited me today with the best of news. He has managed to duplicate the arquebus I got from the Portuguese!\n\nHowever, it turns out to be quite a time-consuming process, and he alone could not make me enough to outfit my troops. Instead, he suggested that I finance a new guild for this specific purpose and for him to be its supervisor.
column3: My swordsmith in [Root.GetName] visited me today with the best of news. He has managed to duplicate the arquebus I got from the Portuguese!\n\nHowever, it turns out to be quite a time-consuming process, and he alone could not make me enough to outfit my troops. Instead, he suggested that I finance a new guild for this specific purpose and for him to be its supervisor.

column2: This might be something to consider.
column3: This might be something to consider.

column2: News reached me today about an interesting development in [From.GetName]. The lord there, [From.Owner.GetFullName], has obtained a new kind of weapon, some sort of handheld firearm called an "arquebus".\n\nThe story goes that he was first given samples of the weapon as a gift from stranded Portuguese traders, and later had his master swordsmith make copies of it. Rumors now say they have started a special guild with the sole purpose of producing them.
column3: News reached me today about an interesting development in [From.GetName]. The lord there, [From.Owner.GetFullName], has obtained a new kind of weapon, some sort of handheld firearm called an "arquebus".\n\nThe story goes that he was first given samples of the weapon as a gift from stranded Portuguese traders, and later had his master swordsmith make copies of it. Rumors now say they have started a special guild with the sole purpose of producing them.

column2: I must try to find out more about this.
column3: I must try to find out more about this.

column2: A foreign ship anchored just off the coast of [Root.GetName] today. Portuguese traders and missionaries came ashore and brought me a message, encouraging me to build a church in [Root.GetName] and convert to their Christian religion. As a gift, they offered me a few samples of the firearm they call "arquebus". Manufacturing more of them could be a good idea, but first, I need someone to figure out how they are made.
column3: A foreign ship anchored just off the coast of [Root.GetName] today. Portuguese traders and missionaries came ashore and brought me a message, encouraging me to build a church in [Root.GetName] and convert to their Christian religion. As a gift, they offered me a few samples of the firearm they call "arquebus". Manufacturing more of them could be a good idea, but first, I need someone to figure out how they are made.

column2: I will give them to my swordsmith.
column3: I will give them to my swordsmith.

column2: I need to establish a swordsmith.
column3: I need to establish a swordsmith.

column2: On a visit to a neighboring province, my advisor, [Root.Owner.Chancellor.GetFullName], made an interesting discovery. He found that they had established a special guild for the sole purpose of making arquebuses. The first prototype had been made by the local swordsmith by copying a Portuguese model. [Root.Chancellor.GetFullName] tracked him down and bribed him to give us a copy of the design. We can now establish our own guild to produce the firearms.
column3: On a visit to a neighboring province, my advisor, [Root.Owner.Chancellor.GetFullName], made an interesting discovery. He found that they had established a special guild for the sole purpose of making arquebuses. The first prototype had been made by the local swordsmith by copying a Portuguese model. [Root.Chancellor.GetFullName] tracked him down and bribed him to give us a copy of the design. We can now establish our own guild to produce the firearms.

column2: Our newfound knowledge of arquebuses could strengthen the clan. Perhaps I should pass this information on to my liege?
column3: Our newfound knowledge of arquebuses could strengthen the clan. Perhaps I should pass this information on to my liege?

column2: That is the right thing to do.
column3: That is the right thing to do.

column2: The less he knows, the better...
column3: The less he knows, the better...

column2: I received a visit from my vassal [From.Owner.GetFullName] today. He wanted to personally inform me that he has obtained the capacity to manufacture arquebuses in [From.GetName], and that he would like to pass this information on to me in order to strengthen the clan's military position. He also advised me to spread the knowledge to the rest of the clan members as well.
column3: I received a visit from my vassal [From.Owner.GetFullName] today. He wanted to personally inform me that he has obtained the capacity to manufacture arquebuses in [From.GetName], and that he would like to pass this information on to me in order to strengthen the clan's military position. He also advised me to spread the knowledge to the rest of the clan members as well.

column2: Very good. I will pass this on.
column3: Very good. I will pass this on.

column2: I will keep this knowledge to myself...
column3: I will keep this knowledge to myself...

column2: A messenger sent by my liege, [Root.Liege], arrived today. He informed me that he has obtained information on how to produce arquebuses and was willing to pass this on to me. He encouraged me to start manufacturing them myself in order to help strengthen the clan.
column3: A messenger sent by my liege, [Root.Liege], arrived today. He informed me that he has obtained information on how to produce arquebuses and was willing to pass this on to me. He encouraged me to start manufacturing them myself in order to help strengthen the clan.

column2: These Western arms do not interest me.
column3: These Western arms do not interest me.

column2: Many lords have tried to keep the information about the arquebus a secret in order to try and preserve an edge over their opponents. However, it seems that enough people now know about how to manufacture them that it could be considered common knowledge.
column3: Many lords have tried to keep the information about the arquebus a secret in order to try and preserve an edge over their opponents. However, it seems that enough people now know about how to manufacture them that it could be considered common knowledge.

column2: On a visit to one of our other provinces, the swordsmith from [Root.GetName] decided to learn more about arquebuses. After spending a few days at the local guild, he felt confident enough to try and make one on his own once he returned home. He was successful, and now we can establish a guild to produce them in [Root.GetName].
column3: On a visit to one of our other provinces, the swordsmith from [Root.GetName] decided to learn more about arquebuses. After spending a few days at the local guild, he felt confident enough to try and make one on his own once he returned home. He was successful, and now we can establish a guild to produce them in [Root.GetName].

column2: I was determined to win the battle in one swift stroke by putting my study of military theories to the test. In an attempt to recreate the tactics of the ancient Minamoto clan, my men rounded up a herd of oxen and tied torches to their horns.\n\nOnce the torches were lit, the frantic herd was supposed to be driven towards the enemy to disrupt their lines. Instead, the furious animals turned around and drove right into my own troops, causing great havoc and ultimately costing me the battle. Maybe the life of a soldier isn't for me after all.
column3: I was determined to win the battle in one swift stroke by putting my study of military theories to the test. In an attempt to recreate the tactics of the ancient Minamoto clan, my men rounded up a herd of oxen and tied torches to their horns.\n\nOnce the torches were lit, the frantic herd was supposed to be driven towards the enemy to disrupt their lines. Instead, the furious animals turned around and drove right into my own troops, causing great havoc and ultimately costing me the battle. Maybe the life of a soldier isn't for me after all.

column2: As my bodyguards were falling all around me, I stood steadfast and personally killed 20 enemies before the rest of my men could come to my aid.
column3: As my bodyguards were falling all around me, I stood steadfast and personally killed 20 enemies before the rest of my men could come to my aid.

column2: As the enemy's army confidently struck out against our position, I led a small detachment in an ambush and managed to inflict a serious blow, routing their vanguard.
column3: As the enemy's army confidently struck out against our position, I led a small detachment in an ambush and managed to inflict a serious blow, routing their vanguard.

column2: The enemy should always be harassed.
column3: The enemy should always be harassed.

column2: When I saw the enemy forces heavily entrenched on the other side of the river, I withdrew and established a camp opposite them. Then, in the middle of night, I sent across a detachment of cavalry, fording the river on their horses. They managed to bypass the enemy outposts, and then carried out a successful attack, striking their camp from the rear.
column3: When I saw the enemy forces heavily entrenched on the other side of the river, I withdrew and established a camp opposite them. Then, in the middle of night, I sent across a detachment of cavalry, fording the river on their horses. They managed to bypass the enemy outposts, and then carried out a successful attack, striking their camp from the rear.

column2: When the barrage from the enemy archers caused my soldiers to retreat, I resolved to hold the bridge at any cost. As the arrows started coming my way, I simply wielded my sword and cut through them. My fearlessness soon inspired my troops to return, and together we charged the enemy, slaying their archers.
column3: When the barrage from the enemy archers caused my soldiers to retreat, I resolved to hold the bridge at any cost. As the arrows started coming my way, I simply wielded my sword and cut through them. My fearlessness soon inspired my troops to return, and together we charged the enemy, slaying their archers.

column2: They call me the arrow-cutter now!
column3: They call me the arrow-cutter now!

column2: When the barrage from the enemy archers caused my soldiers to retreat, I resolved to hold the bridge at any cost. As the arrows started coming my way, I simply wielded my sword and cut through them. My fearlessness impressed even the enemy, but in the end, personal bravery could not alone carry the battle.
column3: When the barrage from the enemy archers caused my soldiers to retreat, I resolved to hold the bridge at any cost. As the arrows started coming my way, I simply wielded my sword and cut through them. My fearlessness impressed even the enemy, but in the end, personal bravery could not alone carry the battle.

column2: They call me the arrow-cutter now!
column3: They call me the arrow-cutter now!

column2: It was obvious that we were losing the battle, and seeing the enemy force charge down on us, my nerves gave way. I simply turned and ran, leaving my troops behind.
column3: It was obvious that we were losing the battle, and seeing the enemy force charge down on us, my nerves gave way. I simply turned and ran, leaving my troops behind.

column2: I have never been all that brave...
column3: I have never been all that brave...

column2: During the fierce fight in the damp and cold, I started to feel sick, and was soon helped to the rear by my troops.
column3: During the fierce fight in the damp and cold, I started to feel sick, and was soon helped to the rear by my troops.

column2: With the enemy on the run and their commander trying to get away, I charged after him, but was struck down by one of his bodyguards.
column3: With the enemy on the run and their commander trying to get away, I charged after him, but was struck down by one of his bodyguards.

column2: Even in glory, there is a price to pay.
column3: Even in glory, there is a price to pay.

column2: In an effort to buy time for my retreating army, me and my personal bodyguard took position behind a ford. We fought a heroic rearguard action, where most of my guards were cut down. I barely escaped.
column3: In an effort to buy time for my retreating army, me and my personal bodyguard took position behind a ford. We fought a heroic rearguard action, where most of my guards were cut down. I barely escaped.

column2: In the heat of battle, an enemy samurai suddenly appeared to strike me from behind. I was soon rescued by one of my loyal retainers, who cut the assailant down, but the attack left me heavily injured.
column3: In the heat of battle, an enemy samurai suddenly appeared to strike me from behind. I was soon rescued by one of my loyal retainers, who cut the assailant down, but the attack left me heavily injured.

column2: I ordered my troops besieging [From.GetName] to set fire to the castle on three sides, and then to concentrate on the forth side. Those who escaped the fire couldn't escape our arrows, and those who feared our arrows couldn't escape the fire.
column3: I ordered my troops besieging [From.GetName] to set fire to the castle on three sides, and then to concentrate on the forth side. Those who escaped the fire couldn't escape our arrows, and those who feared our arrows couldn't escape the fire.

column2: I ordered my troops besieging [From.GetName] to set fire to the castle on three sides, and then to concentrate on the forth side. Those who escaped the fire couldn't escape our arrows, and those who feared our arrows couldn't escape the fire.
column3: I ordered my troops besieging [From.GetName] to set fire to the castle on three sides, and then to concentrate on the forth side. Those who escaped the fire couldn't escape our arrows, and those who feared our arrows couldn't escape the fire.

column2: I ran forth just as my troops began to waver from the defender's fire. I climbed the palisade and cut down the enemy. Rallied by my courageous attack, my troops charged and took the castle in a short, deadly engagement.
column3: I ran forth just as my troops began to waver from the defender's fire. I climbed the palisade and cut down the enemy. Rallied by my courageous attack, my troops charged and took the castle in a short, deadly engagement.

column2: A sheathed sword does no good...
column3: A sheathed sword does no good...

column2: I may have gained personal glory when I joined the last attack that carried the castle of [From.GetName], but it came at a price...
column3: I may have gained personal glory when I joined the last attack that carried the castle of [From.GetName], but it came at a price...

column2: I paid a very high price for leading my troops in the charge through the gateway when trying to take the castle in [From.GetName].
column3: I paid a very high price for leading my troops in the charge through the gateway when trying to take the castle in [From.GetName].

column2: Bad news from the siege of [Root.GetName]! The enemy has managed to lead off most of the water from the moat.
column3: Bad news from the siege of [Root.GetName]! The enemy has managed to lead off most of the water from the moat.

column2: The Emperor has decided to give in to your request and grant you the title of Shogun. The country is far from united however, and strong forces question the legitimacy of your claim to the title.\n\nTo prove yourself worthy of the Ashikaga shogunate, you must maintain your hold over the land for at least [Global.GetShogunateClaimMonths] months, or unite all of Japan under your rule.
column3: The Emperor has decided to give in to your request and grant you the title of Shogun. The country is far from united however, and strong forces question the legitimacy of your claim to the title.\n\nTo prove yourself worthy of the Ashikaga shogunate, you must maintain your hold over the land for at least [Global.GetShogunateClaimMonths] months, or unite all of Japan under your rule.

column2: [From.GetFullName] considers himself to be the supreme military force in Japan and has convinced the Emperor to grant him the title of Shogun. His hold on Japan is still tenuous, however, and there are those who question the legitimacy of this claim. To prove himself worthy of the Ashikaga shogunate, he must maintain his hold over the land for at least [Global.GetShogunateClaimMonths] months, or unite all of Japan under his rule.

column2: You have failed in your attempt to establish yourself as Shogun. As you can no longer claim to be the supreme military force in Japan, the Emperor has decided to revoke your title.

column2:
Most honorable [Root.GetFullName], it has come to my attention that you are the leader of a plot to $AMBITION_NAME$. I find this most interesting...and I bet that others would too. However, I suspect your intention is to keep these matters from the public eye. If so, I will of course not contribute to any such occurrences, so long as my silence is rewarded with a token sum...

Signed,

[From.GetFullName]
column3:
Most honorable [Root.GetFullName], it has come to my attention that you are the leader of a plot to $AMBITION_NAME$. I find this most interesting...and I bet that others would too. However, I suspect your intention is to keep these matters from the public eye. If so, I will of course not contribute to any such occurrences, so long as my silence is rewarded with a token sum...

Signed,

[From.GetFullName]

column2:
Dear $SIBLING$, I write to warn you about a sinister plot against you, concocted by my lord, [From.Liege.GetFullName]. As soon as he can gather enough support, he plans to attack your honorable clan. I pray that my warning will leave you enough time to prepare to meet this threat.

Signed,

[From.GetFullName]
column3:
Dear $SIBLING$, I write to warn you about a sinister plot against you, concocted by my lord, [From.Liege.GetFullName]. As soon as he can gather enough support, he plans to attack your honorable clan. I pray that my warning will leave you enough time to prepare to meet this threat.

Signed,

column2: My Master of the Guard had brought me some troubling news.\n\n"My lord, I have discovered that our plot to $AMBITION_NAME$ has been leaked. One of our courtiers is a relative of $PLOTTARGETNAME$ and has secretly been sending him information. What should we do with this traitor?"
column3: My Master of the Guard had brought me some troubling news.\n\n"My lord, I have discovered that our plot to $AMBITION_NAME$ has been leaked. One of our courtiers is a relative of $PLOTTARGETNAME$ and has secretly been sending him information. What should we do with this traitor?"

column2: If the plot has been leaked, there's nothing to do.
column3: If the plot has been leaked, there's nothing to do.

column2: My conscience is killing me. I watched my liege murder a courtier, and now I'm torn between my loyalty to my liege and telling the victim's family.
column3: My conscience is killing me. I watched my liege murder a courtier, and now I'm torn between my loyalty to my liege and telling the victim's family.

column2: I received an anonymous letter today:\n\n"I feel that you should know the truth about the death of [From.GetFullName]. It wasn't illness or an accident that killed [From.HisHer] - [From.HeShe] was murdered by [From.HisHer] liege. Out of fear of reprisals from my lord, I will not reveal my name, but I feel this was a deed too horrible for me to keep silent on".

column2: Cannot be held as a secondary title
column3: Cannot be held as a secondary title

column2: Can be held as a secondary title
column3: Can be held as a secondary title

column2: Combat has lasted less than ｧY$DAYS$ｧW days
column3: Combat has lasted less than ｧY$DAYS$ｧW days

column2: Combat has lasted at least ｧY$DAYS$ｧW days
column3: Combat has lasted at least ｧY$DAYS$ｧW days

column2: Religion has Authority of at least
column3: Religion has Authority of at least

column2: Does not have the character modifier
column3: Does not have the character modifier

column2: Is NOT the Plot target of
column3: Is NOT the Plot target of

column2: Not defeated in a bid for clan leader
column3: Not defeated in a bid for clan leader

column2: Defeated in a bid for clan leader
column3: Defeated in a bid for clan leader

column2: Do you wish to permanently disable hints?\n(You can reactivate hints from the Settings screen.)
column3: Do you wish to permanently disable hints?\n(You can reactivate hints from the Settings screen.)

column2: Sengokuでは、あなたは日本の封建君主となり、将軍となるため最高権力を得ることを目指します。左上隅でキャラクターの肖像を見られます。
column3: In Sengoku, you play a Japanese feudal lord struggling for ultimate power in a quest to become Shogun. You can see your character portrait in the upper-left corner.

column2: To become Shogun, you must control at least 50% of Japan, either via direct control or via your vassals. After gaining control, you must claim the title of Shogun and maintain control for 36 months. Beware: during this time, your enemies will redouble their efforts to topple you.
column3: To become Shogun, you must control at least 50% of Japan, either via direct control or via your vassals. After gaining control, you must claim the title of Shogun and maintain control for 36 months. Beware: during this time, your enemies will redouble their efforts to topple you.

column2: 新たな封建君主としては、まず家臣団ビューからアドバイザーを任命し、彼らに仕事をさせることから始めるべきでしょう。次に、敵味方を確認するために隣国や直参たちを見てみましょう… あなたに敵対するものへの調略の準備を始めてもよいかもしれません。
column3: As a new feudal lord, you should start by appointing advisors via the Court View and putting them to work. Then take a look at your neighbours and vassals to see who your friends and enemies are... and maybe launch a plot against those who would oppose you.

column2: Sengokuはポーズ可能なリアルタイムゲームです。これはゲームをポーズしている間も時間が進んでいる時と同様に命令を出すことができることを意味しています。ゲームをポーズまたは解除するには、右上隅の日付をクリックするか、Spaceキーを押してください。時間が進むのを早くしたり遅くするには、プラスとマイナスボタンを使用します。
column3: Sengoku is a Pausable Real-Time game. This means that you can issue commands both while the game is paused as well as when the clock is running. To pause or unpause the game, click the date in the upper-right corner or press the Spacebar. Use the plus and minus symbols to speed time up or to slow it down.

column2: Sengoku takes place on a fully 3D map. You can zoom in and out using your mouse scroll wheel, and rotate the map by moving the mouse while holding down the scroll wheel. You can always reset the map by pressing Backspace.
column3: Sengoku takes place on a fully 3D map. You can zoom in and out using your mouse scroll wheel, and rotate the map by moving the mouse while holding down the scroll wheel. You can always reset the map by pressing Backspace.

column2: A daimyo cannot rule his country alone - he needs trusted advisors to do specific jobs. Each position is connected to a certain skill, so when you appoint a character, try to make sure they are both the most skilled character and someone you can trust. Press "Appoint" to appoint a new character.
column3: A daimyo cannot rule his country alone - he needs trusted advisors to do specific jobs. Each position is connected to a certain skill, so when you appoint a character, try to make sure they are both the most skilled character and someone you can trust. Press "Appoint" to appoint a new character.

column2: Your Master of Ceremonies handles negotiations and ceremonies at the court. To do this, he needs a high diplomacy skill.
column3: Your Master of Ceremonies handles negotiations and ceremonies at the court. To do this, he needs a high diplomacy skill.

column2: Improving a village includes managing building and infrastructure projects in the village of a province. This will help you increase your tax base and manpower.
column3: Improving a village includes managing building and infrastructure projects in the village of a province. This will help you increase your tax base and manpower.

column2: Sending an envoy to a neighbouring kori will improve your relationship with its master.
column3: Sending an envoy to a neighbouring kori will improve your relationship with its master.

column2: You can send your envoy to a province and squeeze extra taxes from the peasants. Be aware, however, that this can cause unrest.
column3: You can send your envoy to a province and squeeze extra taxes from the peasants. Be aware, however, that this can cause unrest.

column2: Your Master of Arms is in charge of your army and castle. He will train your troops and defend your castle in your absence.
column3: Your Master of Arms is in charge of your army and castle. He will train your troops and defend your castle in your absence.

column2: You can set your envoy to work on improving one of your castles. This is important because losing a castle means losing that kori.
column3: You can set your envoy to work on improving one of your castles. This is important because losing a castle means losing that kori.

column2: If you set your envoy to recruit ronin, you increase the chance of attracting roving bands of ronin to your lands. You still need to hire them via the Military View, though.
column3: If you set your envoy to recruit ronin, you increase the chance of attracting roving bands of ronin to your lands. You still need to hire them via the Military View, though.

column2: If the peasants become restless, you can send your envoy to suppress them. This can be very useful if your tax collector has been overzealous.
column3: If the peasants become restless, you can send your envoy to suppress them. This can be very useful if your tax collector has been overzealous.

column2: Your Master of the Guard is responsible for your personal security, but he can also use his skills and contacts to accomplish other tasks.
column3: Your Master of the Guard is responsible for your personal security, but he can also use his skills and contacts to accomplish other tasks.

column2: You can convince local guilds to adopt new ideas, giving you the ability to construct more manufactories in your koris.
column3: You can convince local guilds to adopt new ideas, giving you the ability to construct more manufactories in your koris.

column2: To create dissent within a rival clan, you can send your envoy to sour relations between a vassal and his master.
column3: To create dissent within a rival clan, you can send your envoy to sour relations between a vassal and his master.

column2: Ninja clans can be difficult to contact. This job will send your envoy to find them.
column3: Ninja clans can be difficult to contact. This job will send your envoy to find them.

column2: How well you do at the game will depend greatly on the character you currently play and his closest relations. The quality of a person in Sengoku is measured by a number of values.
column3: How well you do at the game will depend greatly on the character you currently play and his closest relations. The quality of a person in Sengoku is measured by a number of values.

column2: Each character has a number of traits. These are gained via events and affect how well your character does, what happens to him, and to some extent, his relationships with others.
column3: Each character has a number of traits. These are gained via events and affect how well your character does, what happens to him, and to some extent, his relationships with others.

column2: Honor is one of the basic currencies in the game. You gain it by handing out titles and giving gifts, among other things, and spend it to advance your power.
column3: Honor is one of the basic currencies in the game. You gain it by handing out titles and giving gifts, among other things, and spend it to advance your power.

column2: Money is the other currency of the game. It's gained via taxation and spent to recruit and maintain troops, hire ninjas, construct guild manufactories, and other helpful activities.
column3: Money is the other currency of the game. It's gained via taxation and spent to recruit and maintain troops, hire ninjas, construct guild manufactories, and other helpful activities.

column2: Beware of spending too much of your honor. If you go below zero, or if your liege commands it, you will be forced to commit seppuku, thereby ending the game. You may wish instead to commit seppuku earlier, in order to preserve your honor and continue playing as your heir.
column3: Beware of spending too much of your honor. If you go below zero, or if your liege commands it, you will be forced to commit seppuku, thereby ending the game. You may wish instead to commit seppuku earlier, in order to preserve your honor and continue playing as your heir.

column2: When you die, you will continue playing as your eldest son. If you do not have a son, you will lose the game upon your death. As such, it's very important to obtain at least one wife.
column3: When you die, you will continue playing as your eldest son. If you do not have a son, you will lose the game upon your death. As such, it's very important to obtain at least one wife.

column2: A clan is ruled with the consent of its members. All members of a clan's leading dynasty that are direct vassals of the clan leader can vote. The vote takes place following the clan leader痴 death. You can nominate your candidate by pressing the "Nominate" button. Your objective should always be to get your heir elected.
column3: A clan is ruled with the consent of its members. All members of a clan's leading dynasty that are direct vassals of the clan leader can vote. The vote takes place following the clan leader痴 death. You can nominate your candidate by pressing the "Nominate" button. Your objective should always be to get your heir elected.

column2: Your armies are your basic tools of conquest. Your armies consist of Samurai cavalry and Ashigaru infantry.
column3: Your armies are your basic tools of conquest. Your armies consist of Samurai cavalry and Ashigaru infantry.

column2: There are two types of armies: Levies and Retinues. Levies are feudal troops raised from your castles, while retinues are standing armies. You can recruit retinues by clicking the "Recruit Retinues" button.
column3: There are two types of armies: Levies and Retinues. Levies are feudal troops raised from your castles, while retinues are standing armies. You can recruit retinues by clicking the "Recruit Retinues" button.

column2: Only independent lords and sufficiently strong vassals can control their own armies. If you cannot control your own army, you must recruit more troops to gain freedom of movement.
column3: Only independent lords and sufficiently strong vassals can control their own armies. If you cannot control your own army, you must recruit more troops to gain freedom of movement.

column2: As the game progresses, you might gain access to arquebus firearms from visiting Europeans. The Europeans will spread the knowledge to your provinces, after which you can establish your own arquebus guild. The arquebus value tells you how large a percentage of your army you can supply with arquebuses.
column3: As the game progresses, you might gain access to arquebus firearms from visiting Europeans. The Europeans will spread the knowledge to your provinces, after which you can establish your own arquebus guild. The arquebus value tells you how large a percentage of your army you can supply with arquebuses.

column2: Your retinues are your standing armies, and as such, they are always connected to a character. You can either recruit troops for your personal retinue or recruit wandering ronin with their own complement of troops. As more wars ravage Japan, more ronin will become available.
column3: Your retinues are your standing armies, and as such, they are always connected to a character. You can either recruit troops for your personal retinue or recruit wandering ronin with their own complement of troops. As more wars ravage Japan, more ronin will become available.

column2: Your retinue cap is the maximum number of retinues you can recruit without incurring a maintenance penalty. Your cap is increased by gaining higher titles and improving buildings. Each unit in your personal retinue counts as one toward the cap, while an entire ronin retinue counts as one.
column3: Your retinue cap is the maximum number of retinues you can recruit without incurring a maintenance penalty. Your cap is increased by gaining higher titles and improving buildings. Each unit in your personal retinue counts as one toward the cap, while an entire ronin retinue counts as one.

column2: Your levies represent the feudal samurai and ashigaru in your provinces. The size of these troops can be increased by upgrading your provinces.
column3: Your levies represent the feudal samurai and ashigaru in your provinces. The size of these troops can be increased by upgrading your provinces.

column2: Your levies can serve you in two ways. You can either leave them where they are to defend the castle, or you can leave a skeleton defence force and raise your levies to serve in your field armies. At the start of the game, this will be the mainstay of your force.
column3: Your levies can serve you in two ways. You can either leave them where they are to defend the castle, or you can leave a skeleton defence force and raise your levies to serve in your field armies. At the start of the game, this will be the mainstay of your force.

column2: While raising your levies will cost you more unit maintenance than usual, you can always return them home by disbanding them. Just remember that if you do this outside your own territory, less soldiers will find their way home.
column3: While raising your levies will cost you more unit maintenance than usual, you can always return them home by disbanding them. Just remember that if you do this outside your own territory, less soldiers will find their way home.

column2: Some of the goals you can seek to achieve in the game, such as breaking free from your clan or attacking another clan leader, can be turned into plots. Once a plot is formed, you can recruit other characters to join it via the Diplomacy View.
column3: Some of the goals you can seek to achieve in the game, such as breaking free from your clan or attacking another clan leader, can be turned into plots. Once a plot is formed, you can recruit other characters to join it via the Diplomacy View.

column2: Each plot has a 菟lot power・that is calculated as the relative military power between the target and the plot backers. Once the plot power reaches a certain limit, you can execute the plot. Some plots, like Attack Title, require that you declare war via the ordinary game mechanics before the plot backers are called in.
column3: Each plot has a 菟lot power・that is calculated as the relative military power between the target and the plot backers. Once the plot power reaches a certain limit, you can execute the plot. Some plots, like Attack Title, require that you declare war via the ordinary game mechanics before the plot backers are called in.

column2: A plot and its members are kept secret from the plot's target. However, if the target has a sufficiently skilled Master of the Guard, a plot can be discovered in advance, giving the target the opportunity to either quietly dispose of the plotters or to expose the plot, costing the plotters honor.
column3: A plot and its members are kept secret from the plot's target. However, if the target has a sufficiently skilled Master of the Guard, a plot can be discovered in advance, giving the target the opportunity to either quietly dispose of the plotters or to expose the plot, costing the plotters honor.

column2: If you want to get anywhere in Sengoku, you need to employ diplomacy, which is done by sending a variety of offers to other characters.
column3: If you want to get anywhere in Sengoku, you need to employ diplomacy, which is done by sending a variety of offers to other characters.

column2: The highest level of diplomacy in Sengoku takes place between clans. Clans declare war, make peace, and exchange hostages. Vassals of clan leaders simply fight in the wars.
column3: The highest level of diplomacy in Sengoku takes place between clans. Clans declare war, make peace, and exchange hostages. Vassals of clan leaders simply fight in the wars.

column2: With a handful of exceptions, most diplomatic actions cost honor. Giving gifts and handing out titles actually gain you honor.
column3: With a handful of exceptions, most diplomatic actions cost honor. Giving gifts and handing out titles actually gain you honor.

column2: The honor cost of declaring war is scaled by the opinion you have of the target clan leader.
column3: The honor cost of declaring war is scaled by the opinion you have of the target clan leader.

column2: You can use ninjas for a number of missions, including assassinating a character, sabotaging a castle during a siege, or protecting you from other ninjas.
column3: You can use ninjas for a number of missions, including assassinating a character, sabotaging a castle during a siege, or protecting you from other ninjas.

column2: To utilize ninjas, you need to recruit a ninja clan. There is a limited amount of ninja clans in Japan and their envoys travel between provinces. When a ninja clan becomes available to you, you will see them appear on this screen, where they will wait for a time to see if you have a mission for them. You can increase the chance of a ninja clan appearing by sending your Master of the Guard on a mission to find them.
column3: To utilize ninjas, you need to recruit a ninja clan. There is a limited amount of ninja clans in Japan and their envoys travel between provinces. When a ninja clan becomes available to you, you will see them appear on this screen, where they will wait for a time to see if you have a mission for them. You can increase the chance of a ninja clan appearing by sending your Master of the Guard on a mission to find them.

column2: Hiring a ninja clan will cost money that is paid up front. The cost depends on the mission you select.
column3: Hiring a ninja clan will cost money that is paid up front. The cost depends on the mission you select.

column2: The success of your ninjas will depend on their ability and stealth. Higher ability means a better chance for a successful mission. Higher stealth means less chance of them being caught. Higher stats translate to higher costs, though.
column3: The success of your ninjas will depend on their ability and stealth. Higher ability means a better chance for a successful mission. Higher stealth means less chance of them being caught. Higher stats translate to higher costs, though.

column2: Sometimes, the target will find out in advance that he is the target of a ninja mission. The best course of action for him then is to have a skilled Master of the Guard, or to hire other ninjas to protect him.
column3: Sometimes, the target will find out in advance that he is the target of a ninja mission. The best course of action for him then is to have a skilled Master of the Guard, or to hire other ninjas to protect him.

column2: One important aspect of the game is to balance your relationship with the various religious factions. At the start of the game, there are two factions: the Shintoists and Buddhists. Christians will appear later in the game.
column3: One important aspect of the game is to balance your relationship with the various religious factions. At the start of the game, there are two factions: the Shintoists and Buddhists. Christians will appear later in the game.

column2: Only clan leaders can have a relation to a faction, which is increased by building the religious structures corresponding to that faction. All religious buildings in realms belonging to you and your vassals count towards this relationship. Note that each province has space for just one such structure, meaning that you might have to anger an existing faction to support a new one.
column3: Only clan leaders can have a relation to a faction, which is increased by building the religious structures corresponding to that faction. All religious buildings in realms belonging to you and your vassals count towards this relationship. Note that each province has space for just one such structure, meaning that you might have to anger an existing faction to support a new one.

column2: Once you have a positive relationship with a faction, you can choose to become a follower, which will grant you certain bonuses. The clan leader with the strongest relationship becomes faction leader, granting him additional bonuses.
column3: Once you have a positive relationship with a faction, you can choose to become a follower, which will grant you certain bonuses. The clan leader with the strongest relationship becomes faction leader, granting him additional bonuses.

column2: If you don't have a good relationship with a faction, they might inspire revolts against you. The size and strength of a revolt depends on the faction's power in your realm and your relationship with them.
column3: If you don't have a good relationship with a faction, they might inspire revolts against you. The size and strength of a revolt depends on the faction's power in your realm and your relationship with them.

column2: You are at war! This means that a state of conflict exists between your clan and the enemy clan. Wars in Sengoku are straightforward, as they are based on the principle that might makes right. Once you take a province, it belongs to you. This simplifies peace negotiations, as all you can agree to is an admission of defeat, a submission to become a vassal, or a White Peace, which ends the conflict as it stands at that moment.
column3: You are at war! This means that a state of conflict exists between your clan and the enemy clan. Wars in Sengoku are straightforward, as they are based on the principle that might makes right. Once you take a province, it belongs to you. This simplifies peace negotiations, as all you can agree to is an admission of defeat, a submission to become a vassal, or a White Peace, which ends the conflict as it stands at that moment.

column2: Your army is in battle. In this screen, you can see how the battle is progressing and some of the factors influencing it. A battle has two phases: fire, when ranged weapons are used, and shock, when melee weapons are used. A die is also cast during every phase to represent the random fortunes of war. After the initial stages of the battle, you can choose to retreat by moving your army to another kuni, though this could result in additional losses.
column3: Your army is in battle. In this screen, you can see how the battle is progressing and some of the factors influencing it. A battle has two phases: fire, when ranged weapons are used, and shock, when melee weapons are used. A die is also cast during every phase to represent the random fortunes of war. After the initial stages of the battle, you can choose to retreat by moving your army to another kuni, though this could result in additional losses.

column2: A siege is in progress. This is when an army has surrounded a hostile castle and is trying to take it. How long this takes depends on the number of defenders and the castle's defensive value. Each castle level has a garrison that is augmented by the local levy, provided it has not been mobilized. If the attackers are outnumbered by the defenders, the siege will be aborted.
column3: A siege is in progress. This is when an army has surrounded a hostile castle and is trying to take it. How long this takes depends on the number of defenders and the castle's defensive value. Each castle level has a garrison that is augmented by the local levy, provided it has not been mobilized. If the attackers are outnumbered by the defenders, the siege will be aborted.

column2: At any time during the siege, you can choose to try to storm the castle by pressing the "Assault" button. If you have yet to create a breach and don't significantly outnumber the enemy, then don't count on the operation being a success
column3: At any time during the siege, you can choose to try to storm the castle by pressing the "Assault" button. If you have yet to create a breach and don't significantly outnumber the enemy, then don't count on the operation being a success

column2: Your realm is made up of kori, which are called "provinces" in other Paradox games. These are the smallest territorial units in the game, and they are at the core of calculations on how much money, troops, etc. the player can possess.
column3: Your realm is made up of kori, which are called "provinces" in other Paradox games. These are the smallest territorial units in the game, and they are at the core of calculations on how much money, troops, etc. the player can possess.

column2: 各郡にはそれぞれ対応する国人の職名があり、これが郡の所有権を意味しています。このビューでは、職を誰が持っているのか、またその人物にとって最重要な外交関係を確認できます。
column3: Each kori has a corresponding kokujin title, which implies ownership of the kori. In this view, you can see the title holder and his most important diplomatic relationships.

column2: 各郡は建築物により改良することができます。あなたが建てられる建築物は3タイプ存在します。
column3: Each kori can be upgraded with buildings. There are three types of buildings you can construct.

column2: The castle is upgraded by giving the task to your Master of Arms. Upgrading the castle gives you more troops as well as defensive benefits in a siege.
column3: The castle is upgraded by giving the task to your Master of Arms. Upgrading the castle gives you more troops as well as defensive benefits in a siege.

column2: The village is upgraded by your Master of Ceremonies. Village improvements give you more tax revenue and increase the Supply Limit. The Supply Limit determines how many active troops the kori can support. Note that, if you have more units than allowed, the soldiers will starve.
column3: The village is upgraded by your Master of Ceremonies. Village improvements give you more tax revenue and increase the Supply Limit. The Supply Limit determines how many active troops the kori can support. Note that, if you have more units than allowed, the soldiers will starve.

column2: There are four guild slots where you can construct manufactories that increase the efficiency of your rule. To create a guild, you must first give your Master of Ceremonies the task of expanding a guild slot. After that, you can build a guild manufactory by clicking the open slot. Once Western influence spreads to your province, you can also build a gunsmith.
column3: There are four guild slots where you can construct manufactories that increase the efficiency of your rule. To create a guild, you must first give your Master of Ceremonies the task of expanding a guild slot. After that, you can build a guild manufactory by clicking the open slot. Once Western influence spreads to your province, you can also build a gunsmith.

column2: またここでは、プロヴィンスの反乱リスクも確認することができます。つまり地元農民が立ち上がる危険性です。あなたが民にとって酷い仕打ちをすれば増加する可能性があります。ですが危険性があまりにも高すぎる場合には、防衛担当を派遣し反乱を鎮圧することができます。
column3: Here you can also see the revolt risk in the province. This is the risk that the local peasants will rise up. This chance can increase if you treat your population badly. If it gets too high, however, you can send your Master of Arms to suppress the rebels.

column2: 民が反乱を起こした場合、反乱軍は各宗教派閥の支援を受けます。近隣にある寺院は反乱を援護し、影響を及ぼすでしょう。反乱の大きさはあなたと宗派との関係に影響されます。例えば、あなたと宗派との関係がすごく悪ければ反乱は大規模になるかもしれません。反乱リスクが0でない時にマウスホバーすることで、どの宗派が扇動しているかと、その支援の程度を確認できます。
column3: If the population revolts, they can receive support from any of the religious factions. The nearby temples will influence which faction supports the rebels. The strength of the revolt is influenced by your relation with the specific faction: if you have really bad relations with a faction, the revolt may grow quite large. Hover your mouse over a non-zero revolt risk to see which faction is agitating there and the extent of their support.

column2: 各郡には各宗派から1つだけ宗教的建築物を建てることができます。寺院を建築すると、その宗派との関係が向上するでしょう。
column3: Each kori can have one religious building from one of the factions. If you build a temple, you will increase your relationship with that faction.

column2: Your armies are your main tool to conquer enemies (everyone not under your rule). To move an army, select it and right-click the target province.
column3: Your armies are your main tool to conquer enemies (everyone not under your rule). To move an army, select it and right-click the target province.

column2: Your armies are composed of Samurai cavalry and Ashigaru infantry. Each unit you recruit will be composed of a combination of both. When you gain access to muskets, your Ashigaru fire value will increase.
column3: Your armies are composed of Samurai cavalry and Ashigaru infantry. Each unit you recruit will be composed of a combination of both. When you gain access to muskets, your Ashigaru fire value will increase.

column2: Your cavalry and infantry are divided into groups led by the character that owns them. This can be you for your personal retinue, a local lord for your levies, or a ronin commander for ronin retinues that you have recruited. These groups cannot be split into subsections: if you wish to split these units, you must move entire groups.
column3: Your cavalry and infantry are divided into groups led by the character that owns them. This can be you for your personal retinue, a local lord for your levies, or a ronin commander for ronin retinues that you have recruited. These groups cannot be split into subsections: if you wish to split these units, you must move entire groups.

column2: The power of your unit is its strength, measured in the number of soldiers and their morale (represented by the green bar). A unit will lose both strength and morale when it goes into combat. When morale reaches zero, the unit will retreat. When the unit's strength reaches zero, it will be destroyed. Morale is recovered by resting out of combat, while strength is regained through reinforcements.
column3: The power of your unit is its strength, measured in the number of soldiers and their morale (represented by the green bar). A unit will lose both strength and morale when it goes into combat. When morale reaches zero, the unit will retreat. When the unit's strength reaches zero, it will be destroyed. Morale is recovered by resting out of combat, while strength is regained through reinforcements.

column2: Retinue units will get a small trickle of reinforcements when resting. However, levies will not directly receive reinforcements. Instead, reinforcements will be generated in the province where the levy was initially raised. If you have a badly damaged levy, you can disband it and then re-raise it from its home province.
column3: Retinue units will get a small trickle of reinforcements when resting. However, levies will not directly receive reinforcements. Instead, reinforcements will be generated in the province where the levy was initially raised. If you have a badly damaged levy, you can disband it and then re-raise it from its home province.

column2: When you want to disband a unit, either to cut down on maintenance costs or to reinforce your levy, you can hit the "Disband" button. Disbanded retinues disappear, but levies get back some of their troops. How many troops you get back depends on whether or not you are in your home territory. Note that there is a button that only disbands the levy component of your army.
column3: When you want to disband a unit, either to cut down on maintenance costs or to reinforce your levy, you can hit the "Disband" button. Disbanded retinues disappear, but levies get back some of their troops. How many troops you get back depends on whether or not you are in your home territory. Note that there is a button that only disbands the levy component of your army.
