column2: The controversy over who would succeed Ashikaga Yoshimasa as Shogun was used as a pretext for war by the two most powerful clans in Japan: the Hosokawa and the Yamana. The war would eventually draw in most of the warrior clans and plunge the country into 'The Warring States Period' - the Sengoku jidai.
column3: The controversy over who would succeed Ashikaga Yoshimasa as Shogun was used as a pretext for war by the two most powerful clans in Japan: the Hosokawa and the Yamana. The war would eventually draw in most of the warrior clans and plunge the country into 'The Warring States Period' - the Sengoku jidai.

column2: 1439年、将軍・足利義教に敗れた足利成氏の兄と、父の足利持氏らは自害させられました。にもかかわらず、次の将軍・足利義政は鎌倉公方として成氏を任命しました。義政は彼を全く信頼しておらず、上杉憲忠に成氏を監視させました。1454年、成氏が持氏の死に関わった上杉家の者を殺害すると、上杉家は報復攻撃を行い、関東地方は混乱に陥いりました。義政は弟の政知を派遣し秩序を回復させようとしましたが、状況の速やかな解決には至らず、政知は伊豆プロヴィンスに留まらねばなりませんでした。
column3: Having been defeated by Shogun Ashikaga Yoshinari in 1439, Shigeuji's older brothers and father, Ashikaga Mochiuji, were forced to commit seppuku. Despite this, the new Shogun, Ashikaga Yoshimasa, later appointed Shigeuji as his deputy in the Kanto region. Not trusting him entirely, Yoshimasa had his ally Uesugi Noritada keep an eye on Shigeuji. When Uesugi, who had played a part in Mochiuji's death, was murdered by Shigeuji in 1454, the Kanto region fell into chaos as the Uesugi clan attacked in revenge. Yoshimasa sent his younger brother Masatomo to help restore order, but, unable to resolve the situation quickly, he had to settle down in Izu Province.

column2: Today, a foreign ship anchored just off the coast of [Root.GetName], and Portuguese traders and missionaries came ashore. They sent me a message, encouraging me to build a church in [Root.GetName] and convert to their Christian religion.\n\nAs a gift, they offered me a few examples of the firearm they call "arquebus". Manufacturing more of them could be a good idea, but first, I need someone to figure out how they are made.

column2: Kuni Map Mode displays the different kunis and the koris they are comprised of. Kunis are the historical provinces of Japan, and each has a daimyo title associated with it. If the player controls every kori in a kuni, they will gain the title of daimyo for that particular kuni.

column3: No, this is a waste of resources.

column2: The swordsmith in [Root.GetName] visited me today with the best of news. He had managed to duplicate the arquebus I got from the Portuguese!\n\nHowever, it turns out to be quite a time-consuming process and he alone could not make me enough to outfit my troops. Instead he suggested that I finance a new guild for this specific purpose to be supervised by him.
column3: The swordsmith in [Root.GetName] visited me today with the best of news. He had managed to duplicate the arquebus I got from the Portuguese!\n\nHowever, it turns out to be quite a time-consuming process and he alone could not make me enough to outfit my troops. Instead he suggested that I finance a new guild for this specific purpose to be supervised by him.

column2: This might be something to consider.
column3: This might be something to consider.

column2: A messenger from [Root.GetName] arrived today with a letter from my master of ceremonies [Root.Owner.Marshal.GetFullName]. He wrote that the construction work being done to the local castle is ahead of schedule!
column3: A messenger from [Root.GetName] arrived today with a letter from my master of ceremonies [Root.Owner.Marshal.GetFullName]. He wrote that the construction work being done to the local castle is ahead of schedule!

column2: My master of ceremonies, [Root.Owner.Marshal.GetFullName], reports bad news from [Root.GetName]. The construction work being done to improve the castle has been delayed by bad weather and now they need more money to be able to finish in time.
column3: My master of ceremonies, [Root.Owner.Marshal.GetFullName], reports bad news from [Root.GetName]. The construction work being done to improve the castle has been delayed by bad weather and now they need more money to be able to finish in time.

column2: The chirping sound of feet upon nightingale floor makes sure no one can sneak through undetected
column3: The chirping sound of feet upon nightingale floor makes sure no one can sneak through undetected

column2: You spare no expense when attempting to climb Mount Fuji
column3: You spare no expense when attempting to climb Mount Fuji

column2: The rock garden is a peaceful place for meditation
column3: The rock garden is a peaceful place for meditation

column2: The hill in the Tsukiyama Garden is a beautiful and perfect vantage point
column3: The hill in the Tsukiyama Garden is a beautiful and perfect vantage point

column2: The Chaniwa Garden, with its tea house, is perfect for entertaining guests
column3: The Chaniwa Garden, with its tea house, is perfect for entertaining guests

column2: You save money but lose honor
column3: You save money but lose honor

column2: [Actor.GetDynName] invites you to $PLOT$. Doing so will cost us $HONOR$ honor ($REFUND$ of which you get back if leaving the plot). The plot has a relative strength of $STRENGTH$.
column3: [Actor.GetDynName] invites you to $PLOT$. Doing so will cost us $HONOR$ honor ($REFUND$ of which you get back if leaving the plot). The plot has a relative strength of $STRENGTH$.

column2: Many lords have tried to keep the information about arquebuses a secret to try and preserve an edge over their opponents. But it seems that enough people now know about how to manufacture these firearms that it could be considered common knowledge.
column3: Many lords have tried to keep the information about arquebuses a secret to try and preserve an edge over their opponents. But it seems that enough people now know about how to manufacture these firearms that it could be considered common knowledge.

column2: On a visit to a neighboring province my advisor, [Root.Owner.Chancellor.GetFullName], made an interesting discovery. He found that they had established a special guild for the sole purpose of making arquebuses. The first prototype had been made by the local swordsmith by copying a Portuguese. [Root.Owner.Chancellor.GetFullName] tracked him down and bribed him to give us a copy of the design. We can now establish our own guild to produce these firearms.
column3: On a visit to a neighboring province my advisor, [Root.Owner.Chancellor.GetFullName], made an interesting discovery. He found that they had established a special guild for the sole purpose of making arquebuses. The first prototype had been made by the local swordsmith by copying a Portuguese. [Root.Owner.Chancellor.GetFullName] tracked him down and bribed him to give us a copy of the design. We can now establish our own guild to produce these firearms.

column2: I will conquer Japan with it!
column3: I will conquer Japan with it!

column2: It all happened so quickly I barely registered the events. We were attacked and one of my friends were dragged away from us by the possibly Ikko-Ikki kidnappers!
column3: It all happened so quickly I barely registered the events. We were attacked and one of my friends were dragged away from us by the possibly Ikko-Ikki kidnappers!

column2: The Ikko-Ikkis overpowered me and silenced me before I could call for help! I fainted and would have been lost for ever if [From.GetFullName] and the guards hadn't managed to free me and capture them.
column3: The Ikko-Ikkis overpowered me and silenced me before I could call for help! I fainted and would have been lost for ever if [From.GetFullName] and the guards hadn't managed to free me and capture them.

column2: [From.GetFullName] was subject to an attempted kidnapping today and seems to be terribly shocked by the experience.
column3: [From.GetFullName] was subject to an attempted kidnapping today and seems to be terribly shocked by the experience.

column2: Put the Ikko-Ikkis in the darkest dungeon, never to be released
column3: Put the Ikko-Ikkis in the darkest dungeon, never to be released

column2: A ninja has been imprisoned by you.
column3: A ninja has been imprisoned by you.

column2: A warrior should not go through life scared, yet you do.
column3: A warrior should not go through life scared, yet you do.

column2: Your devoution to the Shinto religion is pure.
column3: Your devoution to the Shinto religion is pure.

column2: The Uchigatana is a favored weapon by the samurai.
column3: The Uchigatana is a favored weapon by the samurai.

column2: The Ignorant might be perceived as strong but the truth is that he will lose in the long run.
column3: The Ignorant might be perceived as strong but the truth is that he will lose in the long run.

column2: The Indolent is a lazy and slothful person
column3: The Indolent is a lazy and slothful person

column2: I'll bring them a nice present!
column3: I'll bring them a nice present!

column2: A bakeneko haunts your household but also keeps the enemies away.
column3: A bakeneko haunts your household but also keeps the enemies away.

column2: The Jaundiced are unwilling to share the good thing in life with other people.
column3: The Jaundiced are unwilling to share the good thing in life with other people.

column2: A connoisseur has a great taste for the fine arts and good things in life.
column3: A connoisseur has a great taste for the fine arts and good things in life.

column2: The Oblivious chooses to ignore the world around him and lives in his own world.
column3: The Oblivious chooses to ignore the world around him and lives in his own world.

column2: Bragging about his accomplishments, the Boastful can be rather irritating.
column3: Bragging about his accomplishments, the Boastful can be rather irritating.

column2: The sumo in the blue mawashi won!
column3: The sumo in the blue mawashi won!

column2: The sumo in the red mawashi won!
column3: The sumo in the red mawashi won!

column2: If not raised, a province's levy will help defend the castle in the event of a siege.
column3: If not raised, a province's levy will help defend the castle in the event of a siege.

column2: 名誉が0まで減少すると、プレイヤーキャラクターは切腹を命じられ、プレイヤーはゲームオーバーとなります…
column3: If your honor is reduced to zero, your character will be forced to commit seppuku.\nAs a player, this means game over...

column2: プレイヤーはいつでも自分の寄子を雇用することができますが、各プロヴィンスから雑兵を動員できるのは棟梁のみです…
column3: You can always have your own personal retinue, but only the clan leader can raise\nthe levys from each province...

column2: 本ゲームには足軽、侍、鉄砲隊の3タイプの軍事ユニットが存在します…
column3: There are three types of military units in the game.\nAshigaru, Samurai and Arquebusiers...

column2: For an easier start, make sure you select the clan mapmode before you pick who you are going to play.
column3: For an easier start, make sure you select the clan mapmode before you pick who you are going to play.

column2: 婚姻は後継者作りのためだけのものではありません。他家との強固な繋がりを作ることにも用いることができるでしょう。
column3: A marriage is not just for heir making. It can be used to create a stronger bond with another clan.

column2: 直参たちとは常に良い関係を保つようにしてください。さもなければ、彼らは独立して新たな家を興そうとするかもしれません。
column3: Try to keep a good relation with your vassals or they might try to form a new clan.

column2: 直参たちとは常に良い関係を保つようにしてください。さもなければ、彼らはあなたの代わりに棟梁になろうとするかもしれません。
column3: Try to keep a good relation with your vassals or they might try to usurp your clan leader title.

column2: 調略に注意！調略に荷担すれば露見する可能性があります…
column3: Beware of plots! If you join one it might be exposed...

column2: 計画的な婚姻を。男子の数が多く、かつ全員に対して十分な郡を所有していない場合、不幸なことが起こる可能性があります。
column3: Marry wise. If you have too many sons and not enough koris for all of them, bad things might happen.

column2: 高い武芸能力を持った女性は郡の防衛で活躍することができるでしょう。
column3: Women with good Martial skill will be able to defend your koris and do it well.

column2: 内政担当には街の拡張、関係向上、徴税を行うことのできる、高い外交能力が必要とされます。
column3: Your Master of Ceremonies needs a high Diplomacy skill to help you improve Villages, relations and collect taxes.

column2: 軍事担当には城の拡張、浪人登用、反乱鎮圧を行うことのできる、高い武芸能力が必要とされます。
column3: Your Master of Arms need a high Martial skill to help you improve Castles, recruit Ronin and restore order.

column2: 防衛担当には工房の拡張、流言、忍者雇用を行うことのできる、高い陰謀能力が必要とされます。
column3: Your Master of the Guard need a high Intrigue skill to expand Guild slots, sow dissent or hire Ninjas.

column2: 忍者衆は色々と便利です。彼らを利用するのを躊躇わないこと！
column3: Ninja Clans are helpful in many ways, don't hesitate to use them!

column2: 誰かへ贈り物をすれば、好感度が上がり、さらに一定の名誉も獲得することができるでしょう。
column3: If you send a gift to someone they will like you more and you will gain some honor.

column2: 人質交換を行った上でさらに別の他家を攻撃した場合、人質交換を行わなかった場合よりも大きな名誉を得ることができるでしょう。
column3: If you exchange hostages and then attack the other clan, you will take a greater honor hit\nthan if you had not exhanged hostages with the clan.

column2: 種々の宗派はそれぞれ別のことに役立ちます。賢く選択してください。
column3: The different factions is useful for different things, choose wisely.

column2: 神道は名誉を毎月増加させます。
仏教は雑兵と寄子の増強速度を向上します。
column3: Buddhism increases your levies and retinues reinforce speed.

column2: キリスト教は国の税収入を増加させます。
column3: Christianity increases your national tax income.

column2: 棟梁となる男子を指名しておくことを忘れないように！
column3: Don't forget to nominate a son of your own to become clan leader!

column2: 他家と人質交換を行うことで、その家のあなたへの敵対的行動の機会を奪うことができるでしょう。
column3: Exchanging hostages with another clan will reduce the chance\nof hostile actions taken against you.

column2: 勝てば官軍。戦の間にプロヴィンスを占領した者が自動的にその所有者となるでしょう…
column3: Might is right. Whoever captures a province during war\nautomatically owns it...

column2: 収支には注意を払ってください。さもないと、直参たちや軍からの信頼を失うことになるでしょう。
column3: Balance your economy with care or your vassals and troops\nwill lose faith in you.

column2: 資金が0を下回ると軍は士気が低下し、直参たちも動揺します。
column3: Your armies have lower morale when your money is less than zero, you vassals will also be upset.

column2: 反乱プロヴィンスに隣接する全プロヴィンスは反乱リスクが増加します。
column3: All provinces neighboring a rebel province have their revolt risk increased.

column2: 反乱プロヴィンスは誰にも宣戦布告せずに奪取することができます。
column3: Rebel provinces can be taken without having to declare war on anyone.

column2: 幕府：この時代の日本において施行されていた封建制度における政府。将軍政治とも呼ばれる。
column3: Bakufu: Feudal system of government prevalent in Japan in this era. Also known as Shogunate.

column2: 将軍：日本の世襲の軍事独裁者。名目上は天皇に従う。
column3: Shogun: Hereditary military dictator of Japan. Nominally subject to the Emperor.

column2: 大名：1つ以上の国を統治する強力な封建制君主。
column3: Daimyo: Powerful feudal lord in control of one or more Kuni.

column2: 国人：1つ以上の国を統治する地方武士。
column3: Kokujin: Local samurai warrior in control of one or more Kori.

column2: 国：歴史上のプロヴィンスであり、いくつかの郡から構成される。
column3: Kuni: historical province, consisting of several Kori.

column2: 一向一揆：侍の支配に対して立ち上がった地方の暴動。
column3: Ikko-ikki: Local mobs who rose up against Samurai rule.

column2: 忍者：諜報や破壊活動、暗殺に特化した兵。
column3: Ninja: Warrior specialized in espionage, sabotage and assassination.
Samurai: Military retainer of a Daimyo.

column2: 鉄砲隊：火縄銃で武装した歩兵。
column3: Arquebusier: Foot-soldier armed with an arquebus.

column2: 火縄銃：15世紀の先込めマッチロック式銃。
本国には常に予備の軍隊を維持するようにしてください。反乱があったり、昨日の友人に後ろから刺されるかもしれません…
column3: Always keep some troops at home in reserve. There might be a revolt, or a stab in the back\nfrom a former friend...

column2: 一度反乱軍がプロヴィンスに入ってしまうと、追い出すのが困難になってしまいます…
column3: Once rebels are nested into a province, they can be really hard to root out...

column2: 碁：2人で行う中国発祥のボードゲーム。
column3: Go: traditional Chinese board game for two players.

column2: Cavalry and Infantry have halved fire values while Arquebusiers have halved shock values.
column3: Cavalry and Infantry have halved fire values while Arquebusiers have halved shock values.

column2: 全ユニットタイプがプロヴィンスを包囲することができますが、攻撃できるのは鉄砲隊及び歩兵のみです。
column3: All unit types can siege provinces, but only Arquebusiers and Infantry can assault.

column2: Unit upgrade buildings split their bonus between all possible units,\n so a smaller army gets a much larger benefit from them.
column3: Unit upgrade buildings split their bonus between all possible units,\n so a smaller army gets a much larger benefit from them.

column2: Arquebusiers start battles on the front lines and have a doubled fire-attack\n in the first phase, after that they rotate to the rear.
column3: Arquebusiers start battles on the front lines and have a doubled fire-attack\n in the first phase, after that they rotate to the rear.

column2: 5つ以上の郡（プロヴィンス）を所有していると、あなたの民は動揺するようになります。
column3: Your people will get restless if you own more than 5 kori (provinces).

column2: 所領を与えることで家中での名声を上げることができます。
column3: Granting landed titles will make you popular among your clan.

column2: 和平交渉を軽視しないように。
最も強大な家でさえ、後継者なしでは存続できません。
column3: Even the most powerful clan won't survive without an heir.

column2: 徴兵軍は多くのコストがかかります。
column3: Raised armies cost a lot of money.

column2: 徴兵が可能な軍は一切の維持費がかからず、郡が包囲された場合に便利です。
column3: Armies that are available to be raised do not cost any upkeep and are useful when your kori is sieged.

column2: 起伏の激しい地形では一度に戦闘可能なユニットが少ないため、戦場はより小さくなります。
column3: Battlefields are smaller in rough terrain, meaning less units can fight at one time.

column2: You can rearrange items in the outliner by toggling them off and on in the order you want them.
column3: You can rearrange items in the outliner by toggling them off and on in the order you want them.

column2: 家督の後継者が自家の出であることを確かめてください。必要であればあなたの息子を指名することを忘れないでください。
column3: Make sure your clan heir is someone from your own family, don't forget to nominate your son if needed.

column2: 直参たちは常に幸せにしておきましょう。
城の外に居る敵は挑発しましょう。多数の直参が居る大きな城を包囲するのは「ほぼ間違いなく」多大なコストを払うでしょう。
column3: Try to lure your enemy out from his castle. A siege on a well-developed castle with a maxed levy inside WILL be costly for you.

column2: Don't neglect religion. The bonus you can get from each might just give you the edge your clan needs.
column3: Don't neglect religion. The bonus you can get from each might just give you the edge your clan needs.

column2: 他家があなたを攻撃しないことを保証するために人質を交換しましょう。Sengokuでは同盟は存在しません。
column3: Exchange hostages to make sure another clan won't attack you. There are no alliances in Sengoku.

column2: 資金さえ持っていれば、浪人はいつでも現れ、あなたの家を助けてくれるでしょう。
column3: Ronins can appear at any time, ready to assist your clan as long as you have the gold for it.

column2: あなたを高く評価する直参はあなたが指名したのと同じ後継者を支持する可能性が高くなります。
column3: Vassals who have a high opinion of you are more likely to vote for the same heir as you.

column2: 名誉が低い場合は、天皇へ贈り物を送ってください。
column3: Send gifts to the emperor if your honor is low.

column2: 家臣団を用いてプロヴィンスの城や街を拡張してください。戦時に大変な助けとなるでしょう。
column3: Use your court members to improve the castles and villages in your provinces. It will help you greatly in times of war.

column2: Expand guilds to upgrade your provinces. But don't forget to build something as you cannot expand when you already have a free building slot.
column3: Expand guilds to upgrade your provinces. But don't forget to build something as you cannot expand when you already have a free building slot.

column2: 一度に建設や増築できるのは、1プロヴィンスにつき1つの建築物のみです。
column3: You can't build or improve more than one thing in a province at a time.

column2: 婚姻することを忘れずに。後継者がないまま死んでしまうと、ゲームオーバーとなります。
column3: Don't forget to get married. If you die without an heir, the game is over.

column2: 名誉は100以上にはなりません。
名誉が高いと、直参たちからの評価が向上します。
column3: Your vassal's opinion of you improves if you have high honor.

column2: 歩兵と鉄砲隊だけが攻撃を行うことができますが、包囲は全タイプが可能です。
column3: Only infantry and arquebusiers will be used in assaults, but all types can siege.

column2: プロヴィンスを効果的に包囲するには、防御側より多くの部隊群が必要となります。
column3: To effectively siege a province, you must have more combined troops than the defending army.

column2: あなたの家から独立するためには、家中の軍の少なくとも10％をあなたが所有していること、それと棟梁よりも高い名誉が必要です。
column3: To be able to break free from your own clan, you need at least 10% of you clans military and you must have higher honor then your clan leader.

column2: A ronin retinue consists of several units, but only counts as one towards the retinue cap.
column3: A ronin retinue consists of several units, but only counts as one towards the retinue cap.

column2: 直参たちからの評価を向上させる良い方法は、贈り物を与えたり、戦で奪った所領を与えることです。
column3: A good way to increase your vassal's opinion of you is to send them gifts and grant them landed titles claimed in war.

column2: 直参があなたにとって脅威となっている場合は、あなたへの評価を向上させるか、または、排除しましょう。
column3: If a vassal is becoming a threat to you, either increase his opinion of you or try to eliminate him.

column2: 家ビューでは直参が誰を支持しているかを確認することができます。誰を懐柔すれば良いか知るのに便利でしょう。
column3: In the clan view you are able to see how the vassals have voted and so know which characters you'll need to convince to change their vote.

column2: より強大な敵と戦を行うなら、他家への調略を行うのが上策です。
column3: Plotting with other clans is an excellent way to engage in war with a stronger enemy.

column2: 多方面に敵を作るのは不利となることを肝に銘じておいてください。
column3: Keep in mind that a clan with enemies on several fronts is at disadvantage.

column2: 台帳では他家の統計を確認することができます。
column3: You can keep track of the other clan's statistics in the ledger.

column2: 1520年以後、西洋人が現れるようになります。派閥マップモードで彼らの進出を確認することができます。
column3: Westerners can start showing up after 1520, you can track their progress on the faction mapmode.

column2: 西洋の影響範囲が日本の50％に達すると、周知の事実となったと判断され、誰でもその知識を利用可能になります。
column3: Once western influence has spread to 50% of Japan it is considered common knowledge and so available to everyone.

column2: 妻は4人まで持つことができます。後継者を作るのに良いでしょう。
column3: You can have up to four wives, which can give you a better chance to produce an heir.

column2: 知行画面では一度に複数の所領を与えることができます。
column3: You can grant multiple landed titles at once on the Grant landed title screen.

column2: 軍が山を移動する際には、行軍速度が低下します。
column3: Your armies will travel much slower in mountains.

column2: 山地の郡において防戦する場合には、大きな防衛ボーナスを得ることができます。
column3: When your army defend in a mountain kori, they get a big defensive bonus.

column2: 城は攻撃によりダメージを受ける可能性があります。
column3: Castles may be damaged by assaults.

column2: Can not build while ｧYExpanding GuildsｧW.
column3: Can not build while ｧYExpanding GuildsｧW.

column2: You need a leader in command of a siege to give the assault order.
column3: You need a leader in command of a siege to give the assault order.

column2: This is the morale of the Ashigaru and Arquebusiers involved in the siege.
column3: This is the morale of the Ashigaru and Arquebusiers involved in the siege.

column2: $COST$ when we have armies in their territory or en route.
column3: $COST$ when we have armies in their territory or en route.

column2: One of my stablemen has taken an interest in the ladies of my court, especially my most beautiful sister. I do not enjoy what can be read in his gaze.
column3: One of my stablemen has taken an interest in the ladies of my court, especially my most beautiful sister. I do not enjoy what can be read in his gaze.

column2: I send the stableman to one of my vassals
column3: I send the stableman to one of my vassals

column2: My vassal's treasury is running low. I should help him
column3: My vassal's treasury is running low. I should help him

column2: I let one of my vassals deal with it
column3: I let one of my vassals deal with it

column2: Mayhaps one of my vassals would be interested
column3: Mayhaps one of my vassals would be interested

column2: I ask a vassal know for his scheming for help
column3: I ask a vassal know for his scheming for help

column2: I gift the weave to my favourite vassal
column3: I gift the weave to my favourite vassal

column2: To celebrate, I'll invite my vassals for tea
column3: To celebrate, I'll invite my vassals for tea

column2: Proudly, I tell my vassals about it
column3: Proudly, I tell my vassals about it

column2: I brought honor to my clan
column3: I brought honor to my clan

column2: One of my vassals praises my gorgeous garden and my orchids especially, as though I wasn't already aware of their beauty.
column3: One of my vassals praises my gorgeous garden and my orchids especially, as though I wasn't already aware of their beauty.

column2: I've been invited to play Go with a friend, and I now find myself one step away from winning. What to do...
column3: I've been invited to play Go with a friend, and I now find myself one step away from winning. What to do...

column2: I place them in opposite prison cells
column3: I place them in opposite prison cells

column2: I'm complimented for taking pride in myself and the beautiful things I own. my  I'm not sure why, but I知 proud nonetheless.
column3: I'm complimented for taking pride in myself and the beautiful things I own. my  I'm not sure why, but I知 proud nonetheless.

column2: I thank my complimenter for the kind words
column3: I thank my complimenter for the kind words

column2: I brag about the compliment I got
column3: I brag about the compliment I got

column2: I was compensated for the sabotaged kumihimos
column3: I was compensated for the sabotaged kumihimos

column2: I confront my vassal about this. He claims innocence, bah!
column3: I confront my vassal about this. He claims innocence, bah!

column2: Afterwards, I might send it as a gift to a vassal
column3: Afterwards, I might send it as a gift to a vassal

column2: A vassal wants to steal the glory! How insolent of him!
column3: A vassal wants to steal the glory! How insolent of him!

column2: I set up what I consider to be a brilliant strategy in preparation for the coming battle. However, one of my vassals presented a plan that even I must admit is very good. The question is now which plan I should choose.
column3: I set up what I consider to be a brilliant strategy in preparation for the coming battle. However, one of my vassals presented a plan that even I must admit is very good. The question is now which plan I should choose.

column2: I'll listen to his plan first
column3: I'll listen to his plan first

column2: Mine is much better, it's brilliant!
column3: Mine is much better, it's brilliant!

column2: I finally get the opportunity to play my music for the court! But as I'm about to perform, I hear that my host is letting me perform in the place of one of the courtiers' spouses.
column3: I finally get the opportunity to play my music for the court! But as I'm about to perform, I hear that my host is letting me perform in the place of one of the courtiers' spouses.

column2: My friend has asked me to join him for a game of Go. However, I'm already aware that my friend is not very good at the game. Troubled, I try to decide what to do...
column3: My friend has asked me to join him for a game of Go. However, I'm already aware that my friend is not very good at the game. Troubled, I try to decide what to do...

column2: I buy some books to start studying
column3: I buy some books to start studying

column2: No one currently holds the Daimyo title
column3: No one currently holds the Daimyo title

column2: The mounted archery called Yabusame is an honorable practice.
column3: The mounted archery called Yabusame is an honorable practice.

column2: A nearby independent clan leader has grown too strong for my liking. I do not fear them, yet I am wary of them.
column3: A nearby independent clan leader has grown too strong for my liking. I do not fear them, yet I am wary of them.

column2: I will not cease until they have perished!
column3: I will not cease until they have perished!

column2: The clan leader's opinion of you will decrease
column3: The clan leader's opinion of you will decrease

column2: They are no threat to us!
column3: They are no threat to us!

column2: Reports from [From.Location.GetName] tells us [From.GetFullName] does not look kindly upon rivals such as us and it is likely [From.HeShe] follow our progress with interest and suspicion.
column3: Reports from [From.Location.GetName] tells us [From.GetFullName] does not look kindly upon rivals such as us and it is likely [From.HeShe] follow our progress with interest and suspicion.

column2: To crumble and wither the strength of my rivals I need allies. There must be another clan that feels as threatened by them as I do!
column3: To crumble and wither the strength of my rivals I need allies. There must be another clan that feels as threatened by them as I do!

column2: I will send messengers to all nearby clans!
column3: I will send messengers to all nearby clans!

column2: A clan leader responds to your message
column3: A clan leader responds to your message

column2: A messenger from [From.GetFullName] arrived with a urgent message today. The [From.GetDynName] clan asks for an alliance against their rival and urges me to choose their side in the conflict.
column3: A messenger from [From.GetFullName] arrived with a urgent message today. The [From.GetDynName] clan asks for an alliance against their rival and urges me to choose their side in the conflict.

column2: We have more in common with [From.GetDynName]'s rivals than with them!
column3: We have more in common with [From.GetDynName]'s rivals than with them!

column2: They are not our rivals, tell the [From.GetDynName] clan I will not interfere
column3: They are not our rivals, tell the [From.GetDynName] clan I will not interfere

column2: The messenger returned from [From.Location.GetName] with [From.GetFullName]'s answer regarding our hopefully mutual rival.
column3: The messenger returned from [From.Location.GetName] with [From.GetFullName]'s answer regarding our hopefully mutual rival.

column2: [From.GetFullName] don't want anything to do with this!
column3: [From.GetFullName] don't want anything to do with this!

column2: Despite my warnings and the might of my retinues, the rival clan leader does not seem to understand that they should stand back and accept me as their overlord!
column3: Despite my warnings and the might of my retinues, the rival clan leader does not seem to understand that they should stand back and accept me as their overlord!

column2: What stops me from attacking them right now?
column3: What stops me from attacking them right now?

column2: It was supposed to be a honorable archery duel between my samurai and one from the rival clan but the arrow pierced through the horse's eye and killed it instantly, crushing its rider under it as it fell. No matter what I did, the samurai's clan leader was furious and did not accept any kind of conciliation.
column3: It was supposed to be a honorable archery duel between my samurai and one from the rival clan but the arrow pierced through the horse's eye and killed it instantly, crushing its rider under it as it fell. No matter what I did, the samurai's clan leader was furious and did not accept any kind of conciliation.

column2: It was not my fault! You should have trained him better!
column3: It was not my fault! You should have trained him better!

column2: To not let my warriors grow fat and comfortable I decided to send them tiger hunting. They returned empty handed and told me rival samurai had already killed and started skinning the tiger they had been sent out to kill.
column3: To not let my warriors grow fat and comfortable I decided to send them tiger hunting. They returned empty handed and told me rival samurai had already killed and started skinning the tiger they had been sent out to kill.

column2: My rivals dishonor me by hunting in my provinces!
column3: My rivals dishonor me by hunting in my provinces!

column2: The tiger is dead at least
column3: The tiger is dead at least

column2: I do believe my rival has noticed my forced hospitality and the irritation I had barely managed to hide whenever our paths cross. A gift with a humble apology arrived yesterday and although I still see him as my rival, my relation with him could improve.
column3: I do believe my rival has noticed my forced hospitality and the irritation I had barely managed to hide whenever our paths cross. A gift with a humble apology arrived yesterday and although I still see him as my rival, my relation with him could improve.

column2: The rivalry between our clans has not brought any good, only deaths and dishonorable actions. Maybe I should take the first step to see if we could end the rivalry between us?
column3: The rivalry between our clans has not brought any good, only deaths and dishonorable actions. Maybe I should take the first step to see if we could end the rivalry between us?

column2: I sent a messenger to the rival clan leder and asked if he would join me for some tea. He graciously accepted and as we sat there, contemplating and discussing whatever fell in mind, I began to feel the rivalry between our clans might be unjustified.
column3: I sent a messenger to the rival clan leder and asked if he would join me for some tea. He graciously accepted and as we sat there, contemplating and discussing whatever fell in mind, I began to feel the rivalry between our clans might be unjustified.

column2: I still do not trust him
column3: I still do not trust him

column2: A vassal is clearly disappointed with me and I cannot for the world understand why.
column3: A vassal is clearly disappointed with me and I cannot for the world understand why.

column2: Everything can be solved with some gold!
column3: Everything can be solved with some gold!

column2: I was promised a small reward from my liege in exchange for the use of my samurai but when they returned, wounded and exhausted, the gold was nowhere to be seen.
column3: I was promised a small reward from my liege in exchange for the use of my samurai but when they returned, wounded and exhausted, the gold was nowhere to be seen.

column2: I should wait patiently for the reward
column3: I should wait patiently for the reward

column2: A loyal vassal should serve his liege until death, but the way [Root.Liege.GetFullName] neglects us, his vassals, makes me want to reconsider this.
column3: A loyal vassal should serve his liege until death, but the way [Root.Liege.GetFullName] neglects us, his vassals, makes me want to reconsider this.

column2: There is probably a reason why he behaves this way
column3: There is probably a reason why he behaves this way

column2: [Root.Liege.GetFullName] invited me to his tea ceremony. As we drank our tea in contemplating silence I could feel his eyes upon me and my hatred of him must have shown. He asked me to forgive him and tried to mend the gap that had opened between us with gifts and fair words.
column3: [Root.Liege.GetFullName] invited me to his tea ceremony. As we drank our tea in contemplating silence I could feel his eyes upon me and my hatred of him must have shown. He asked me to forgive him and tried to mend the gap that had opened between us with gifts and fair words.

column2: I cannot forgive him that easily
column3: I cannot forgive him that easily

column2: [From.GetFullName] joined me for a tea ceremony and as we talked I subtly steered the conversation onto loyalty and respect. I saw how [From.HisHer] face reddened and when [From.HeShe] put [From.HisHer] bowl I feared it might break. After a long talk it seemed as [From.GetFullName]'s hatred had been quelled and then disappeared.
column3: [From.GetFullName] joined me for a tea ceremony and as we talked I subtly steered the conversation onto loyalty and respect. I saw how [From.HisHer] face reddened and when [From.HeShe] put [From.HisHer] bowl I feared it might break. After a long talk it seemed as [From.GetFullName]'s hatred had been quelled and then disappeared.

column2: Despite my kind words and numerous gifts, [From.GetFullName]'s hatred only grew.
column3: Despite my kind words and numerous gifts, [From.GetFullName]'s hatred only grew.

column2: [Root.Liege.GetFullName] has acted in a most dishonorable way towards me and everyone in his court. There is no doubt about it, [Root.Liege.HeShe] must either be insane or a drunkard!
column3: [Root.Liege.GetFullName] has acted in a most dishonorable way towards me and everyone in his court. There is no doubt about it, [Root.Liege.HeShe] must either be insane or a drunkard!

column3: I should not judge my liege!

column2: 西部の島である九州には、数百年に及ぶ長い歴史を持ったいくつかの家が存在していました。南部3国を統治する島津家棟梁が時節の到来を待っている頃、大内家と少弐家、大友家は九州北部の覇権をかけて争っていました。
column3: In Kyushu, the western island, there were several clans with rich histories spanning over hundreds of years. The Ouchi, Shoni and Otomo were fighting for the hegemony of the northern Kyushu while the clan leader of Shimazu, who owned three Kuni in the southern area, bided his time.

column2: 大崎家と最上家は将軍によって任命された奥州管領でしたが、伊達家や南部家などの他家も同様に強大であり、このパワーバランスによりこの地域全体を1つの家が支配することは不可能になっていました。
column3: The Osaki and Mogami clan had been assigned by the shogunate as regional governers of Tohoku but other clans like Date and Nanbu were equally strong and this power balance made it impossible for any one clan to control this region entirely.

column2: 将軍になるためには、あなたと直参たちで日本の50％を支配下に置かねばなりません。その後、将軍職を要求した上で、さらに3年間支配を維持しなければなりません。注意：この間に、あなたの敵たちはあなたを打倒する行動を激化させることでしょう。
column3: To become Shogun, you and your vassals must together control at least 50% of Japan. After gaining control, you must claim the title of Shogun and maintain control for 3 years. Beware: during this time, your enemies will redouble their efforts to topple you.

column2: Sengokuは全て3Dマップ上で進行します。マウスホイールを使いズーム、Ctrlキーを押しながらマウスを動かすことで回転できます。マウスホイールを押しながらマウスを動かすとパンします。BackSpaceキーでいつでもマップをリセットできます。
column3: Sengoku takes place on a fully 3D map. You can zoom in and out using your mouse scroll wheel and rotate the map by moving the mouse while pressing Control. Holding down the scroll wheel and moving the mouse lets you pan. You can always reset the map by pressing Backspace.

column2: 将軍・足利義政の跡継ぎ争い（義政の息子か、兄弟の足利義視か）は、日本における2つの有力家、細川家と山名家の戦争の口実となりました。後に応仁の乱として知られるこの内乱は、5月末に首都において戦闘が発生し開始されました。今や多くの他家に支持された両軍は何年にも渡り衝突し続けるでしょう。またこの争いは日本中の家を巻き込み、国は「内戦状態」、つまり戦国時代へと突入していくことになるでしょう。
column3: The controversy over who would succeed Ashikaga Yoshimasa as Shogun - his son or his brother Ashikaga Yoshimi - was used as a pretext for war by the two most powerful clans in Japan: the Hosokawa and the Yamana. The conflict which would eventually be known as the Onin War started in late May when fighting broke out in the capital. The two sides, now backed by a number of other clans, would continue to clash for years and the war would eventually draw in most of the warrior clans in Japan and plunge the country into 'The Warring States Period' - the Sengoku jidai.
